newsitem.title: UK: EMI extends advance amid bid talk.
newsitem.headline: EMI extends advance amid bid talk.

text.p: Shares in music publisher EMI Group continued their rally on Wednesday, climbing to their highest level in more than two months, amid ongoing bid speculation and hopes for strong Christmas sales, dealers said.
At 0845 GMT, the shares were up 19-1/2p to 1380p.
Dealers noted a recent buy recommendation from Natwest, which highlighted thinning backlogs and a pickup in the U.S. market, buoying expectations for a strong Christmas season.
"Add that to bid talk," said one dealer. "The (bid) speculation is still around and it's not going to go away."
